title: INDIGENOUS ANIMALS IN SRI LANKA
subtitle: Indigenous Animals
introduction: Sri Lanka, the pearl of the Indian Ocean, is a land teeming with unique and fascinating creatures. Its geographical isolation and diverse habitats have fostered an extraordinary level of endemism, meaning a staggering number of species found nowhere else on Earth. The unique ecosystems found in Sri Lanka, including rainforests, dry forests, coastal areas, and wetlands, contribute to the presence of a variety of wildlife species. Here's a brief introduction to some of the indigenous animals in Sri Lanka:

animals.name: Ceylon Birdwing (Troides darsius)
animals.description: Sri Lanka's largest species of butterflies. Found in tropical rainforests, this species is distinguished by its striking black and green wings.

animals.name: Indian Pangolin (Manis crassicaudata)
animals.description: An unusual-looking species of scaly anteater. Mostly nocturnal, it uses its long, sticky tongue to eat termites and ants.

animals.name: Purple-faced Langur (Semnopithecus vetulus)
animals.description: A species of endemic primate distinguished by its purple face. Lives in Sri Lanka's rainforests and is frequently observed in groups.

animals.name: Sri Lanka Junglefowl (Gallus lafayettii)
animals.description: The Sri Lankan national bird. Famous for having feathers that are vivid and colorful, along with wattles and a unique comb.

animals.name: Loris (Nycticebus spp.)
animals.description: Primate nocturnal species characterized by big eyes and slow, deliberate movements. Found in a variety of woodland environments and distinguished by their distinct way of moving.

animals.name: Toque Macaque (Macaca sinica)
animals.description: A monkey of medium size with a distinctive hair "toque" on its head. Found in a range of environments, such as cities, woods, and cultural sites.

animals.name: Sri Lanka Frogmouth (Batrachostomus moniliger)
animals.description: An interesting bird species native to Sri Lanka, known for its cryptic plumage and nocturnal habits.

animals.name: Indian Star Tortoise (Geochelone elegans)
animals.description: Found in certain regions of Sri Lanka, the Indian star tortoise is known for its attractive shell pattern.

animals.name: Kandyan Dwarf Toad (Adenomus kandianus)
animals.description: This toad is endemic to Sri Lanka and is primarily found in the central hills region.
